title: Logarithmic Transformation: Speed vs. Miles per Gallon
question_text: A consumer report gave the following regression equation on the relationship between the speed ( $s$ ) in miles per hour and the average miles per gallon at that speed ( $a$ ) for a particular car: $$\widehat {\log (a)} =0.971+0.363\cdot\log (s)$$ Which of the following is closest to the predicted average miles per gallon when the speed of the car is $45$ miles per hour?
